results.title: The Man from Laramie
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, William Goetz and Anthony Mann
results.brief_description: Anthony Mann’s classic western tells the story of Will Lockhart (James Stewart) and his search for revenge for the death of his youngest brother. He leaves Laramie in search of the men who sold automatic rifles to the Apache tribe which killed his brother. He arrives in Coronado and is soon embroilled in a bitter battle with the Waggoman family who own most of the land and cattle in the township. Full of great characters and twists in plot, “The Man From Laramie” is an enthralling film with characters who defy simplistic moralistic platitutes.

results.title: The Mambo kings
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, La Studia Canal, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, Arnon Milchan and Arne Glimcher
results.brief_description: It is the early fifties and with a suitcase full of songs and hearts full of passion, two brothers leave Cuba and come to America in search of their Dream. They start a band and play the Mambo, Samba and Cha-cha in a nightclub every night. This is the story of their quest for show business fame based on the Pulitzer Prize winning “The Mambo Kings play Songs of Love” by Oscar Hjuelos. This film abounds with exciting Latin American music and fascinating footage of the “I Love Lucy” show is matched with footage of the brothers when their big break arrives. Stars Armand Assante and Antonio Banderas.

results.title: The Maltese falcon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and John Huston
results.brief_description: In this classic Humphrey Bogart film noir, John Huston sketches a dark cynical world with painfully deep perception. Sam Spade, Dashiell Hammett’s archetypal private eye, is caught in the desperate search for the jewelled falcon of Malta. Spade’s pursuit of his partner’s killer leads him to a group of individuals who want the black bird: Brigid O’Shaughnessy (Mary Astor), the beautiful femme fatale, cowardly Joel Cairo (Peter Lorre) and pompously inflated Kasper Gutman (Sydney Greenstreet) and as the falcon comes within their reach their intense greed is sharply etched. Huston also wrote the script.

results.title: The Malta story
results.creator_credit: British Film-Makers Limited, Peter de Sarigny and Brian Hurst
results.brief_description: RAF camera reconnaissance pilot Peter Ross (Alec Guinness) is trapped on the island of Malta when his plane is destroyed enroute to Egypt in a bombing raid. While in Malta, Ross discovers that Italy is planning to invade, but the mission is thwarted as Allied control prevents the attack. With the Allied presence in place, Peter begins the dangerous task of tracing an enemy convoy carrying supplies to the German Army in North Africa, a mission that is fraught with danger, as communication to the Allied forces will alert the enemy to Peter’s position. Cast includes Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, Anthony Steel, Muriel Pavlow and Flora Robson.

results.title: The Magnificent seven (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mirisch Corporation, Alpha Company and John Sturges
results.brief_description: In a stroke of filmmaking inspiration, director John Sturges saw the possibility of transposing Akira Kurosawa’s film classic “The Seven Samurai”, from feudal Japan to the American West and it worked brilliantly. Yul Brynner stars as the leader of a group of skilled gunfighters hired to protect a poor Mexican village from marauding bandits led by the vicious Calvera, played with ruthless delight by Eli Wallach. Fighting alongside Brynner and Steve McQueen are Charles Bronson, James Coburn and Robert Vaughn, whose film careers were launched by this film. With a now-classic musical score and stunning cinematography, “the Magnificent Seven” provides exciting entertainment as well as touching on the themes of dignity, honour, courage and survival. The film established a new standard for future generations of Westerns.

results.title: The Magic sword: quest for Camelot
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Dalisa Cohen and Frederick DuChan
results.brief_description: Set in the time of King Arthur, a renegade knight sets out to seize power by stealing the sword Excalibur. Brave Hayley, who longs to become a knight, sets out together with a young blind hermit, a dragon and a falcon, to foil his plot, recover the magic sword, and save the kingdom. Featuring the voices of Cary Elwes, Gary Oldman, Eric Idle, Pierce Brosnan and Sir John Gielgud.

results.title: The Magic box
results.creator_credit: Festival Film Production, Ronald Neame and John Boulting
results.brief_description: A dramatised biography of William Friese-Greene (1855-1921), a British pioneer of the cinema. Adapted by Eric Ambler from the controversial biography by Ray Allister, the film contends that Friese-Greene was the true father of motion pictures, rather than the better known Thomas Edison. Told largely in flashback, the film details Friese-Greene’s tireless experimentation with the moving-image which mostly ended in failure and which eventually cost him his family and his reputation. The legitimacy of the claims for Friese-Greene became a central issue in the criticism of the film. Made for the 1951 Festival of Britain, ‘The Magic Box’ features Robert Donat in the lead role and a huge supporting cast including such British film luminaries as Joyce Grenfell, Miles Malleson, Michael Redgrave, Eric Portman, Emlyn Williams, Richard Attenborough, Peter Ustinov, Cecil Parker, Kay Walsh, and Laurence Olivier.

results.title: The Madness of King George
results.creator_credit: Close Call Film Production, Stephen Evans, David Parfitt, Nicholas Hytner and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Alan Bennett, “The Madness of King George” stars Nigel Hawthorne as the ailing King and Helen Mirren as his wife Queen Charlotte. King George the Third, after he lost the American colonies in the War of Independence, succumbed to intermittent bouts of madness where his usual ordered and calm persona underwent a violent and obscene transformation. The Prince of Wales becomes a willing pawn in the plot to commit the King, and establish the Regency. This is a finely acted and sumptuous production of Bennett’s play. Ian Holm plays the Doctor called in to cure the King’s madness using methods which from a modern vantage were brutal and inhumane.

results.title: The Love bug
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Walsh and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: Herbie is one of Disney’s most popular live action characters. Affectionately nicknamed ‘The Love Bug’, Herbie teams up with an unsuccessful race-car driver, Jim Douglas. Jim is amazed to find his driving improves in his new car, but realises the success is due to the car with a mind of its own when someone tries to steal Herbie. Starring Dean Jones, David Tomlinson, Michele Lee and Buddy Hackett.
